text: Thallium(III) oxide, also known as thallic oxide, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Tl2O3. It has thallium and oxide ions in it. The thallium is in its +3 oxidation state. ==Properties== Thallium(III) oxide is a white powder. It is very heavy and very toxic. It is a semiconductor. It reacts with acids to make other toxic thallium compounds. It does not dissolve in water. ==Preparation== It is made by oxidation of thallium(I) oxide. ==Uses== It may be used in solar cells. ==Related pages== *Thallium(I) chloride *Silver(I) oxide Category:Thallium compounds Category:Oxides
title: Thallium(III) oxide
